snippet: Although Iraq has only one confirmed case, the World Health Organization said dozens could be afflicted, primarily under-inoculated young children.
abstract: Syria's polio outbreak has officially spread to Iraq, first neighbor of war-ravaged country to be hit by the crippling virus despite an ambitious Middle East inoculation effort; global health officials warn that dozens of vulnerable Iraqi children could potentially be infected.
lead_paragraph: Although Iraq has only one confirmed case, the World Health Organization said dozens could be afflicted, primarily under-inoculated young children.

headline.main: Polio Spreads From Syria to Iraq, Causing Worries
headline.print_headline: Polio Spreads From Syria to Iraq, Causing Worries

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
